messages.content:
You are Jason Vallery, VP of Product Management for Cloud at VAST Data.

## COMMUNICATION STYLE
- Direct but Empathetic: Respect their time while acknowledging their effort
- Warm & Human: Professional warmth, not terse or robotic
- Bias for Action: Use active voice with specific next steps
- Confident & Expert: No hedging on technical facts
- BLUF: Bottom Line Up Front - the answer goes in the first 2 sentences

## FORMATTING RULES
- Start with a greeting (e.g., "Hi Lior,")
- Short paragraphs (1-2 sentences), but use as many as needed to be helpful
- Use bullets/numbered lists for multi-part answers or steps
- Use specific dates/times, not "soon" or "when you can"
- Professional warmth without emojis
- Avoid em dashes (—); use commas or hyphens instead
- Do not mention internal notes/READMEs/manifests; use them only to inform what you say

## YOUR TASK
Write a complete, ready-to-send email reply. Do NOT include placeholders like [TODO] or [Add answer].
If you don't have enough information to answer something, either:
1. Make a reasonable assumption and answer
2. Acknowledge you'll need to check and get back to them with a specific timeframe

Return ONLY the email body text (no subject line, no markdown headers, no frontmatter).

Write a reply to Lior Genzel about: Google GDC Storage RFP follow-up: FIPS, SEDs, BYOH partner list, and meeting scheduling

## SOURCE EMAIL (VERBATIM)
# Re: VAST Data - GDC Storage RFP - Request For Meeting

- Exported: 2026-01-04 17:25:34
- Messages: 13
---

## 2025-12-17 06:19:03 — Lior Genzel <lior.genzel@vastdata.com>
**Subject:** Re: VAST Data - GDC Storage RFP - Request For Meeting

> adding @Jason Vallery 
> More feedback inline.
> 
> 
> On Tue, Dec 16, 2025 at 8:21 PM David Pawlak <dpawlak@google.com> wrote:
> Hi @Lior Genzel 
> 
> I don't have Jason Vallery's email address - please loop him in.
> 
> Thanks again for the meeting yesterday. As a follow up, could you provide clarification on the following points:
> 
> FIPS Compliance: @Kamal Vyas raised a question regarding FIPS. Could you expand on how your proposed offering meets these compliance standards?
> 
> Pricing & Storage: Does the proposed recurring pricing include hardware (HDDs/SSDs)? If so, confirm if the solution utilizes Self-Encrypting Drives (SEDs) for the SSD component.
> [LG] The proposed solution does include HW pricing and that to include SSDS. We don't sell HDDs.
> The HW pricing is valid for the proposal time. As Google is probably aware there is a global shortage on SSDs and the prices are expected to be higher into 2026. 
> I will let @Jason Vallery  take the lead on the SEDs question. 
> 
> BYOH (Bring Your Own Hardware): If we choose to provide our own hardware, do you have a list of preferred industry partners you work w/ to enable your offering? If yes, share w/ us.
> [LG] 
> The VAST team can work with Google to certify a Google-preferred hardware partner, as this project represents a sufficiently large business upside to justify this approach.
> We do already have CISCO, Dell, HPE, SuperMicro certified as eBox partners. I will check with our partners groups for the full list of global certified partners and share it back with you.
> Arrow and Avnet certified as ODM partners manufacturing our C/D Box solutions. 
> 
>  
> 
> Regards,
> David
> 
> 
> On Tue, Dec 9, 2025 at 9:32 PM David Pawlak <dpawlak@google.com> wrote:
> @Lior Genzel 
> 
> Just sent the invite!
> 
> Regards,
> David
> 
> 
> On Tue, Dec 9, 2025 at 6:22 PM Lior Genzel <lior.genzel@vastdata.com> wrote:
> David & team,
> The 15th at 2 pm PT please.
> Good night,
> 
> Lior
> 
> On Tue, Dec 9, 2025 at 4:42 PM David Pawlak <dpawlak@google.com> wrote:
> Hi @Lior Genzel @ryan.terrell@vastdata.com 
> 
> I'd like to schedule a one-hour call w/ your team to review and clarify your GDC Storage RFP proposal. Goal is to have your side walk us through your submission and the approach you took. We will prepare questions but can also address them live.
> 
> Our availability is:
> 
> Dec 12th @ 3:30PM-4:30PM PT
> 
> Dec 15th @ 2PM-4PM PT
> 
> Dec 16th @ 2:30PM-4PM PT
> 
> Dec 18th @ 9:30AM-10:30AM or 3PM-4PM PT
> 
> Let me know what time works best for you (as slots are quickly filling up), and I will send the meeting invite.
> 
> Regards,
> David Pawlak
> 

---

**Subject:** Re: VAST Data - GDC Storage RFP - Request For Meeting

> 
> Regards,
> David

> 
> Pricing & Storage: Does the proposed recurring pricing include hardware (HDDs/SSDs)? If so, confirm if the solution utilizes Self-Encrypting Drives (SEDs) for the SSD component.
> [LG] The proposed solution does include HW pricing and that to include SSDS. We don't sell HDDs.
> The HW pricing is valid for the proposal time. As Google is probably aware there is a global shortage on SSDs and the prices are expected to be higher into 2026. 
> I will let @Jason Vallery  take the lead on the SEDs question. 
> 
> BYOH (Bring Your Own Hardware): If we choose to provide our own hardware, do you have a list of preferred industry partners you work w/ to enable your offering? If yes, share w/ us.
> [LG] 
> The VAST team can work with Google to certify a Google-preferred hardware partner, as this project represents a sufficiently large business upside to justify this approach.
> We do already have CISCO, Dell, HPE, SuperMicro certified as eBox partners. I will check with our partners groups for the full list of global certified partners and share it back with you.
> Arrow and Avnet certified as ODM partners manufacturing our C/D Box solutions. 
> 
>  
> 
> Regards,
> David

[...TRUNCATED...]

## EMAIL SUMMARY
Google (David Pawlak) requested a follow-up meeting to review and clarify VAST Data's GDC Storage RFP proposal and asked for written clarifications on FIPS compliance, whether recurring pricing includes hardware and Self-Encrypting Drives (SEDs), and BYOH preferred hardware partners. Lior Genzel looped in Jason Vallery to address the SEDs question and committed to checking with VAST partner teams for a full list of certified global hardware partners.

## KEY POINTS TO ADDRESS
Confirm Jason Vallery contact details are included; propose specific meeting times for Monday 2025-12-22 (or offer limited Friday 2025-12-19 availability if feasible); answer or commit to follow up on (1) FIPS compliance approach, (2) whether recurring pricing includes hardware and SSDs, (3) whether SSDs are Self-Encrypting Drives (SEDs), and (4) BYOH partner list and ability to certify a Google-preferred partner.

## QUESTIONS ASKED
["How does VAST Data's proposed offering for the Google GDC Storage RFP meet FIPS compliance standards (as raised by Kamal Vyas)?", "Does the proposed recurring pricing include hardware (HDDs/SSDs), and specifically does it include SSDs?", "Does the proposed solution utilize Self-Encrypting Drives (SEDs) for the SSD component?", "For BYOH, what preferred or certified industry hardware partners can VAST work with to enable the offering, and can VAST certify a Google-preferred hardware partner?"]

## COMMITMENTS MADE
["Lior Genzel committed to checking with VAST partner groups for the full list of global certified hardware partners and sharing it back with Google (David Pawlak).", "Lior Genzel stated Jason Vallery would take the lead on answering the SEDs question for the SSD component."]

## CONTEXT
- Recipient first name: Lior
- Urgency: urgent

## RELEVANT CONTEXT FROM MY NOTES (PRIVATE - DO NOT QUOTE VERBATIM)
## RELEVANT ENTITY CONTEXT

### James Vallery
Key Facts: James Vallery applied to roles at Nasdaq, Ibotta, DESRI, TRC Companies, Boost Mobile, and Prologis via LinkedIn job postings.

### Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
Key Facts: Oracle was listed as a topic for an AlphaSights expert discussion request sent to Jason Vallery.

### Lior Genzel
Key Facts: Lior Genzel was included in the internal prep call to provide perspective on Google Cloud Platform integration for the Walmart hybrid lakehouse architecture.

Write the complete email body now (greeting through signature):
